meanings.definition: A market or marketplace, especially in the Middle East or South Asia.
meanings.sent1: The bustling bazar was filled with colorful stalls selling spices and fabrics.
meanings.sent2: I bought some fresh fruits from the local bazar.
meanings.sent3: At the bazar, I found a talking parrot for sale!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a bazar of thoughts, each one vying for attention.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of exotic spices in the bazar lingered in my memory.

meanings.definition: A shop or stall selling a variety of goods.
meanings.sent1: The small bazar on the corner sold handmade jewelry and souvenirs.
meanings.sent2: She visited the bazar to pick up some fresh vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The bazar owner dressed up as a clown to attract more customers.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a bazar of ideas, each one more creative than the last.
meanings.sent5: The bazar displayed a colorful array of trinkets and treasures.
